page.title: 04Bryanston School
page.content: 1985 was a difficult year in schools because of{pay disputes.}Bryanston was not directly affected, being private. The Governors gave a{pay increase}to staff to match salaries in comparable schools after discussion with the Head. Staff were much concerned with preparing for{the new exams at 16+. The School launched{an appeal}for money to build new craft & technical centres.The architect, Richard Burton, produced an overall plan & the support of the designer Sir Terence Conran was given; both are former pupils. Privilege creates conscience. Plans were made in the summer term for an autumn{Charities Fair}to involve all the pupils & staff. A barbecue, discos and a Valentine's Ball raised money to go to various charities.Pupils made a sponsored parachute jump in June. The African famines had a great impact.
